intro: Eclipta quinquenervis, commonly known as the five-veined false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with five distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. Eclipta quinquenervis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats including roadsides and fields.
